The band issued the single "Black Betty" the following year, and in September of 2012 fully re-emerged with the full-length album "Meat + Bone." They'll be part of the upcoming Coachella invasion, alongside more than 30 other bands expected to rock out during the festival. They also have a full tour schedule in the UK upcoming, with dates booked through May., 4812=On March 24, the Jon Spencer Blues Explosion will release its brand new album "Freedom Tower – No Wave Dance Party 2015." The album is due out on the Mom + Pop Label, and is set to follow the band's 2012 'comeback' album "Meat + Bone.", 3865=In support of the LP, Jon Spencer Blues Explosion has also lined up a spring U.S. tour. It will kick off February 14 at the Music Hall of Williamsburg in Brooklyn and wrap on April 25 at Rex Theater in Pittsburgh. The event in Brooklyn is as part of the Planned Parenthood Valentine's Day Benefit that will also feature Shannon Funchess (Light Asylum), Lenny Kaye (Patti Smith Group), Julianna Barwick, Austin Brown (Parquet Courts), Cassie Ramone (The Babies, ex-Vivian Girls), Brad Oberhofer (Oberhofer), Crocodiles, EZTV, and Christian Peslak (Saint Rich/Delicate Steve) and DJ Jonathan Toubin. Tickets are still available., 2397=The Blue's Explosion's real breakthrough came with the release of "Extra Width" in 1993. The band secured coveted airtime on MTV's alt-rock showcase "120 Minutes" with the video for the song "Afro." The band's sound also changed, backed by funky beats and loaded with pop-standard hooks and riffs that generated a brand new excitement for the trio.}
textBeforeTable: 2015 Tour Dates Low price $6 High price $50 Average Price $24 Past 12 Months Find Tickets The Jon Spencer Blues Explosion Ticket Prices Though the Blues Explosion eventually went on an extended hiatus, they re-formed to play some shows when their catalog received a 'deluxe' reissue treatment in 2010. The band issued the single "Black Betty" the following year, and in September of 2012 fully re-emerged with the full-length album "Meat + Bone." They'll be part of the upcoming Coachella invasion, alongside more than 30 other bands expected to rock out during the festival. They also have a full tour schedule in the UK upcoming, with dates booked through May. The Blue's Explosion's real breakthrough came with the release of "Extra Width" in 1993. The band secured coveted airtime on MTV's alt-rock showcase "120 Minutes" with the video for the song "Afro." The band's sound also changed, backed by funky beats and loaded with pop-standard hooks and riffs that generated a brand new excitement for the trio.
